*(I now have compiled `glib2`, which provides the files `/usr/lib/libgio-2.0.so.0` and `/usr/lib/libglib-2.0.so.0`, with debugging symbols, too.)*  
*Note that I do not* understand *the GDB backtrace. I just copy it here because sometimes it helps others.*

@all, can you at least comment on this issue, please?

note.body:
Issue still present, with git version 1.37.0.dev+23, git commit hash 0c10126a.

In the kernel log:  
```c++
[21136.489240] [T20326] nm-applet[20326]: segfault at 1e94 ip 00007f995339c406 sp 00007ffdfd653610 error 4 in libmm-glib.so.0.10.0[77406,7f9953369000+76000] likely on CPU 11 (core 3, socket 0)
[21136.489264] [T20326] Code: 06 00 31 ff ff 15 42 59 0a 00 31 c0 5b c3 66 0f 1f 44 00 00 f3 0f 1e fa 53 48 89 fb ff 15 ca 57 0a 00 48 85 db 74 35 48 89 c6 <48> 8b 03 48 85 c0 74 05 48 39 30 74 0d 48 89 df ff 15 1c 5c 0a 00
```

No comment yet from the developers since about one year.

Regards!

note.body:
Applied, thanks.

I removed the bit that checks if nm_client exists; we need to fix it differently: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/network-manager-applet/-/merge_requests/149

target_title: Modems not showing after resume from suspend due to D-Bus race

note.body:
Yes. Thanks for the patch, applied it now.

Removed this bit:

```
+       if (!applet->nm_client)
+               return;
```

I think it got there by accident. The matter of fact is that we completely shit our pants wherever we fail to create the NMClient. Alternative fix: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/network-manager-applet/-/merge_requests/149

note.body: Yes, correct.

target_title: [RFE] Ask for firewall zone upon first connection

note.body:
I think this would be useful, but might be needed just when asking for a network password.

As an laptop user, I may visit a lot of networks (identified by SSID), where no password is needed. Such networks are typically public networks, which I as an user should not trust. Everything transmitter over that networks needs encryption, otherwise everyone can read it.

I would like to have option to choose non-default zone when entering a password required for the network. When I am connecting trusted work or home network, I typically need to specify password. When that password is not a public knowledge, that network can be trusted more. I may want to assign work, home or other firewall zones. For a roaming laptop, I think public default makes more sense. But I need then a way to change "trust" for that network quickly.

target_title: editor/vpn: consult plugin caps instead of error for missing editor

note.body: Let's see if I understand well: if the daemon is newer enough it will return the NM_VPN_EDITOR_PLUGIN_CAPABILITY_NO_EDITOR. If it's not newer enough, this flag will always be 0 and it won't work as expected, but it doesn't matter because it wasn't working with the G_FILE_ERROR_NOENT anyway. Is that right?

target_title: Updated symbolic icon assets with those from adwaita-icon-theme

note.body:
They come from me making them for this MR, they can follow the license of this repo that already governs the assets.  I can clarify that I am synchronizing the icons _visual metaphors_ with those in adwaita-icon-theme, not copying assets from one place to another.

The design team has been going through many GNOME modules to address issues with dated symbolic icon assets and replace them with plain SVG instead of Inkscape SVG; Inkscape doesn't save as plain SVG by default so it bloats the filesize with extraneous metadata. In this MR I've stripped that metadata from the existing non-symbolic assets with a script this has no impact on them being editable.

target_title: Updated symbolic icon assets with those from adwaita-icon-theme

note.body:
Hi. I am unable to review this. We need to know the source and the license that covers the files at the very least. Could you please elaborate a bit in the commit message where precisely these files come from and import them without modifications?

If there's a reason to care about size of these icons (is there?), the conversion needs to happen at build time, while the repository will hold unmodified files.
